brief_description_of_case: LLEWELLYN was riding her cycle on the carraigeway when a VW Golf driven by WILLIAMS coming from the opposite direction crossed on to the other side of the road on the wrong side of a keep left bollard. This manoeuvre caused LLEWELLYN to fall from her cycle. WILLIAMS was using his hand held mobile phone at the time. In interview WILLIAMS admits his driving was dangerous.

offence.charge_wording: On the 16th of February 2015 at Anytown drove a mechanically propelled vehicle, namely a VW Golf registered number N103 PLP dangerously on a road, namely High Street. Contrary to section 2 of the Road Traffic Act 1988 and Schedule 2 to the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988.
offence.points_to_prove_met_by:
date and location - statement from victim, MME, and admission in interview 
 drove a mechanically propelled vehicle dangerously on road- statement from victim, MME, and admission in interview

multimedia_evidence_response.defendant_comments_if_shown:
Q: Are you driving the silver Ford Fiesta shown in the video 
 A: Yes

interview.admissions_made:
Admits being the driver, admits going the wrong side of the bollard and being on his handheld mobile phone 
 Q: Do you accept that your driving fell far below the standard expected? 
 A: I’ve just passed my test. I’m sorry.
interview.explanations:
Q: The footage shows you passing the bollard on the wrong side of the road, causing a cyclist to fall from her bicycle. Why did you do this? 
 A: I had just overtaken a stationary vehicle and didn’t see the bollard until the last minute. 
 Q: Do you agree that the footage shows you are using your mobile phone during the manoeuvre. 
 A:  I’m sorry it was a really important call, my wife is expecting a baby.
interview.mitigations: Stated he had just passed his driving test.

witness.nature_of_involvement: Road user effected by the defendants drivivng
witness.evidence_they_can_give: Witnessed the driving and recorded it on her head cam.

multimedia_evidence.description_of_what_is_contained_in_mult: At 10:00 Evidence shows Williams coming towards the cyclist on the wrong side of a keep left bollard whilst using his mobile phone.
